title.narrative: Engendering Agricultural Research: Needs, Gaps, and Opportunities for Gender Training in East Africa
La recherche agricole adaptée aux sexes : Besoins, lacunes et possibilités en matière de formation en Afrique de l'Est

description.narrative: This project aims to increase the gender responsiveness of agricultural research in East Africa. The need for it is widely recognized. For decades, it has been expressed in global, regional, and national strategies. However, agricultural research projects and programs remain largely "gender blind" in their design and implementation. Gender challenges in agricultural research Gender training programs have been successful in sensitizing agricultural researchers and organizations to the importance of gender, but they have been too general. They have not effectively equipped and trained individuals and organizations with the specific tools and methods needed for research design. International collaboration to advance research Through this project, Makerere University's School of Gender and Women Studies and the College of Agriculture and Information Sciences will work with Cornell University to: -assess the current status of gender capacity and gender responsive agriculture in Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, and Rwanda -use the results of the analysis to develop a gender and agriculture training program for teams conducting agricultural research in the region -pilot the program and develop a monitoring and evaluation framework to assess the gender responsiveness of research The training modules will be specific to agricultural research to increase uptake and effectiveness. Examples of the modules include gender and value chains, and gender and nutrition. Designed as a blended learning model, the materials will focus on biophysical and social scientists' needs, and combine face-to-face instruction with field work and online mentoring support. Evidence for advancing gender issues in agriculture The expected project results are: -comprehensive review of policy and practice drivers and barriers for gender responsiveness research in national and regional agricultural research organizations in East Africa -peer-reviewed publication on individual and institutional factors determining the success of gender training -training modules for gender and value chains research -monitoring and evaluation framework and assessment tool for gender responsive research
